oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Clarence Saunders Store No. 2
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: advertising; Saunders, Clarence; billboards; art; business; grocery stores;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An illustrated billboard, presumedly at the site where Memphis businessman Clarence Saunders was to build a new store. The cartoon refers to Saunders' having declared bankrupcy twice before: in 1923 with Piggly Wiggly, and 1930 with Clarence Saunders Sole Owner of My Name Stores.
